solution_line_template: Single dog is ${charge_per_dog} + ({minutes_dog1} minutes * ${cost_per_minute_per_dog} per minute) = $<<{charge_per_dog}+{minutes_dog1}*{cost_per_minute_per_dog}={cost_dog1}>>{cost_dog1}.

Two dogs are {num_dogs_batch2} * (${charge_per_dog} + ({minutes_dog2} minutes * ${cost_per_minute_per_dog} per minute)) = $<<{num_dogs_batch2}*({charge_per_dog}+{minutes_dog2}*{cost_per_minute_per_dog})={cost_dog2}>>{cost_dog2}

Three dogs are {num_dogs_batch3} * (${charge_per_dog} + ({minutes_dog3} minutes * ${cost_per_minute_per_dog} per minute)) = $<<{num_dogs_batch3}*({charge_per_dog}+{minutes_dog3}*{cost_per_minute_per_dog})={cost_dog3}>>{cost_dog3}
